Description: Rectangular fragment of ivory inlay: decorated with deeply incised lines running vertically and diagonally across the face. One end is broken away but the other end is preserved and is bevelled for inlaying. The grooves on the face still contain a small amount of dark pigment.
Curator's comments: For pieces with the same pattern, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls.XXXVII, 43-5; XXXVIII, 60; XL, 61; XLI, 2, 13, 19; XLIII, 45; E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ I, (1895-6), pl. XLII. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl.XLII, 43.
